meanings.sent1: Yesterday, he toadied to his boss by agreeing with everything she said.
meanings.sent2: She toadied to the teacher in hopes of getting a better grade.
meanings.sent3: The student toadied to the principal by offering to carry her books.
meanings.sent4: The politician toadied to the voters, promising everything they wanted.
meanings.sent5: The employee toadied to the manager, hoping for a promotion.

meanings.definition: toadied: acted as a sycophant or flatterer
meanings.sent1: She toadied to the celebrity, complimenting their every move.
meanings.sent2: The assistant toadied to the director to gain favor in the office.
meanings.sent3: The cat toadied to its owner by purring loudly for extra treats.
meanings.sent4: The salesperson toadied to the customer, praising their taste in products.
meanings.sent5: He toadied to his friend, hoping for an invitation to the party.

meanings.definition: toadied: ingratiated oneself with someone in a servile manner
meanings.sent1: The intern toadied to the CEO, fetching coffee and running errands.
meanings.sent2: She toadied to the professor, offering to do extra research for him.
meanings.sent3: The dog toadied to its owner by rolling over for belly rubs.
meanings.sent4: The assistant toadied to the manager, always agreeing with his decisions.
meanings.sent5: He toadied to his neighbor, hoping to borrow some tools.
